citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult dog was found with untreated dental disease. Barbie, a six-year-old female Yorkie (m/c# 991001898038409) had
excessive tarter build up on her canines and molars. On her right side both her canine teeth are halfway covered, while
the rest of her teeth are completely covered in a thick hard dark brown buildup. There is a milky white creme like buildup
of material at the top of the teeth and under the gum line on the two upper teeth behind the canine. The gums on this side
are red and swollen. On her left side the upper canine and the bottom two teeth behind the canine are 3/4 covered while
the upper tooth behind the canine and the upper molar are completely covered in a thick hard dark brown buildup. The
tooth behind the upper canine and upper molar has gum recession. The gums have recessed so much on the upper back
molar the root is visible. The gums on this side are also red and swollen. Poor dental health can cause pain and
discomfort to the animal and can lead to further health issues. This dog must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for
an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan. Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of
veterinary care for dogs that includes preventative care and treatment to ensure healthy teeth for all dogs.
Correct by January 31, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. .
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An adult dog was found with untreated dental disease. Barbie, a six-year-old female Yorkie (m/c# 991001898038409) had 
excessive tarter build up on her canines and molars. On her right side both her canine teeth are halfway covered, while 
the rest of her teeth are completely covered in a thick hard dark brown buildup. There is a milky white creme like buildup 
of material at the top of the teeth and under the gum line on the two upper teeth behind the canine. The gums on this side 
are red and swollen. On her left side the upper canine and the bottom two teeth behind the canine are 3/4 covered while 
the upper tooth behind the canine and the upper molar are completely covered in a thick hard dark brown buildup. The 
tooth behind the upper canine and upper molar has gum recession. The gums have recessed so much on the upper back 
molar the root is visible. The gums on this side are also red and swollen. Poor dental health can cause pain and 
discomfort to the animal and can lead to further health issues. This dog must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for 
an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan. Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of 
veterinary care for dogs that includes preventative care and treatment to ensure healthy teeth for all dogs.  
Correct by January 31, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. . 
 
 n
